meanings.definition: Refusing to acknowledge or accept responsibility for something.
meanings.sent1: The disavowing man refused to admit his mistake.
meanings.sent2: She felt uncomfortable around the disavowing individual.
meanings.sent3: The disavowing cat pretended the broken vase was not its fault.
meanings.sent4: The disavowing storm clouds refused to take credit for the rain.
meanings.sent5: The disavowing student avoided the truth at all costs.

meanings.definition: Denying any connection or association with something.
meanings.sent1: The disavowing group distanced themselves from the controversial issue.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his disavowing attitude towards gossip.
meanings.sent3: The disavowing squirrel claimed it had no ties to the missing nuts.
meanings.sent4: The disavowing shadow seemed to detach itself from the object.
meanings.sent5: The disavowing actor refused to be linked to the scandal.

meanings.sent1: She was disavowing all responsibility for the failed project.
meanings.sent2: The company was disavowing any involvement in the environmental damage.
meanings.sent3: The disavowing tree shed its leaves in protest.
meanings.sent4: The disavowing politician turned away from his former allies.
meanings.sent5: The disavowing parent refused to acknowledge their child's behavior.
